result.execSummary:
The defendant William James Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for William James Lewis
Current: 1350 Tiffany Street, Boyceville, WI 54725 United States  (Effective: 04-27-2015)
Prior: N2035 479th, Menomonie, WI 54751 United States
Sentencing-02-20-15

Defendant, William James Lewis, in custody, appeared with Attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Defendant in custody.  Brad Erickson in court.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(1:53)
Both parties have received PSI 
State - no corrections
Yonko - no corrections
State - has no statement to make
Yonko - deft has a number of family members - no one wishes to make statement
State - argues sentencing - is agreement - not recommending prison - PSI didn't include a sentence in MN, deft plead to felony with 5 yrs probation and 50 days jail - deft is also on bond in Dunn Co. 15CF38, no agreement in that case - wasn't charged as repeater in this case and could of been - deft recd his GED in jail, respectful with the PSI writer, had troubling upbringing, has high need for treatment - recommends deft be placed probation 5 yrs complete inpatient treatment, do any alcohol or drug follow up & cc 
Yonko - agreement was to not request prison time
State - credit for 215 days - recommends straight probation - would like six months to be available, conditional jail imposed & stayed
Yonko - argues sentence - requests 2-3 yrs prob
Deft - right to allocution

COURT:  
Prison - 3 yrs prison; 18 mo IC 18 mo ES - concurrent to anything deft is serving
CC - statutory costs as determined by COC  - lowest amount possible per the Court
Challenge Incarceration Program - Substance Abuse Program deft is eligible for both programs
credit 215 days served
Not eligible to vote
